timeline.bodyText: For this and many other places touched in this PR, would it make sense to use # as the flag in the format specifier and eliminate the explicit 0x in the string?   In this particular instance, "%#016" OMR_PRIx64)
timeline.author: 0xdaryl

replies.bodyText: Sorry for the scope creep.  But since you're changing the format specifier anyway it seems like an opportune moment to do this.
replies.author: 0xdaryl

replies.bodyText: That would make the 0x prefix conditional, a change that I think belongs in a separate pull-request (if at all).
replies.author: keithc-ca

timeline.message:
Use portable formats from omrformatconsts.h

* eliminates numerous '-Wformat' warnings

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>

Use portable formats from omrformatconsts.h

* eliminates numerous '-Wformat' warnings

Signed-off-by: Keith W. Campbell <keithc@ca.ibm.com>
